fields.Name: iTunes Volume Control
fields.Notes: Not being able to control my iTunes volume with my keyboard drives me insane. I'm still not sure why Apple decided to do that, but thankfully there are people out there who dislike this "feature" as much as I do and wrote a little menu bar app to fix it!
fields.Jekyll Recommendation:
---
name: iTunes Volume Control
url: https://github.com/alberti42/iTunes-Volume-Control
image_url: /assets/recommendations/itunes-volume-control.png
type: macOS App
date: 2019-12-01 10:12
last_updated: 2022-03-28 10:03
---
Not being able to control my iTunes volume with my keyboard drives me insane. I'm still not sure why Apple decided to do that, but thankfully there are people out there who dislike this "feature" as much as I do and wrote a little menu bar app to fix it!

I'm still not sure why Apple decided to do that, but thankfully there are people out there who dislike this "feature" as much as I do and wrote a little menu bar app to fix it!

fields.Name: JuneCloud Toolbox
fields.Notes: If you want to create a symbolic link (like a shortcut, but when applications look they see the contents of the link rather than a link), or make a file name web friendly, these are some easy services you can install on your Mac to do that. And they're Automator actions too.
fields.Jekyll Recommendation:
---

url: https://junecloud.com/software/mac/junecloud-toolbox.html

type: macOS App

date: 2021-12-09 12:12
last_updated: 2022-03-28 10:03
---
If you want to create a symbolic link (like a shortcut, but when applications look they see the contents of the link rather than a link), or make a file name web friendly, these are some easy services you can install on your Mac to do that. And they're Automator actions too.

And they're Automator actions too.$$

fields.Name: MacSparky Hazel Field Guide
fields.Notes: If I hadn't watched this field guide I feel like my use of Hazel would be practically non-existant. This application is very helpful but seeing David break down the use cases and how they work really inspired me and helped me get it all set up.

---
If I hadn't watched this field guide I feel like my use of Hazel would be practically non-existant. This application is very helpful but seeing David break down the use cases and how they work really inspired me and helped me get it all set up.
